April 18, I960
Mr, Franklin D. Bouwaraa
Executive Secretary
Detroit Educational Televieion
Foundation
12300 Radio Place
Detroit 28, Michigan
Dear Frank1
NAEB HEAOQUARTtRS
APR 1 9 '1960
7*8iÂ»|Xp|U!l2|l|2|3i4|6|9
I
Thank you very much for your detailed letter of April 11* I want
to tell you that 1 appreciate the time and trouble you have gone to
to express your views.
Actually I feel that the content* of your letter, while undoubtedly
dealing with public relations in its broadest sense, go into
important elements of NAEB policy. These are matters which our
committee could make recommendations about, but could hardly take
definitive action on.
I hope you will be at the Institute so we can discuss these things
in more detail. I plan to drive up Wednesday morning. May k and
return Saturday, May 7. If you are planning to be there and will
let me know approximately when, we can make plans to get together.
Again, thank you for your thoughtful interest.
Sincerely.
SOS1mm
ccj H. Skomia;/
Elmer 0. Sulzer, Director
Radio and Television Communications
